choices.name: Get started with research for your Wyoming ancestors.

hidden.content:
• Learn successful research strategies for Wyoming ancestors.
  • Record Finder: Use the Record Finder to determine records for Wyoming research.

content.text:
1. Introduction: Learn about basic Wyoming research strategies.

    ☆ FS—Basic Wyoming Research Tips and Strategies

  2. Follow this research study for Wyoming ancestors, from 1880 to the present.

    ☆ FS—Step-by-Step Wyoming Research, 1880-Present

  3. Ancestry: Explore resources for Wyoming research on Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Wyoming Resources
    ☆ AC—Wyoming State Research Guide, 5 pgs.

  4. Record Finder: Use the Wyoming Record Finder to decide on records to search.

    ☆ FS—Wyoming Record Finder

    5. Additional Records
    1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
    2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
    3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

    Ethnic
    1. African American: Learn about African Americans in Wyoming in these FamilySearch Wiki articles.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for Wyoming

    2. Native American: Learn about American Indians in Wyoming in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

      ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of Wyoming


Additional Records
  1. Explore a variety of records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.
  2. Explore historical photo sites on ☆Ancestor Hunt.
  3. Explore resources for school yearbooks on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.
Ethnic
  1. African American: Learn about African Americans in Wyoming in these FamilySearch Wiki articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: African American Resources for Wyoming

  2. Native American: Learn about American Indians in Wyoming in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Indians of Wyoming

1. Explore Wyoming historical resources on FamilySearch.

    ☆ FS—Wyoming History

  2. Explore Wyoming history on Wikipedia.

    ☆ History
    ☆ History of Wyoming

  3. Learn about Wyoming history on InfoPlease.com.

    ☆ Wyoming History

choices.name: Learn about Wyoming archives and libraries.

hidden.content:
• Explore statewide and regional collections.
  • Explore books and photos that can be helpful in your research.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for archives and libraries. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about Wyoming archives and libraries in these articles.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Wyoming Archives and Libraries
    ☆ Wyoming State Archives: Wonderful Local Sources for Genealogical Research

  2. Find genealogy resources on the Wyoming State Archives site.
  3. Explore the State Archives and Libraries site for Wyoming.
  4. Explore Wyoming Dept. of Archives collection.
  5. Explore the ☆Books We Own site for Wyoming genealogy publications. Volunteers may be available for lookup services.
  6. Search for ☆free online books on Wyoming research on the FamilySearch site.
  7. Photos: Explore historical photo resources on the ☆Ancestor Hunt site.

hidden.content:
• Explore city and county directories to find Wyoming ancestors.
  • Discover the different types of information in directories, such as streets, churches, historical info, etc.

• * Good: Using the articles and videos in this Choice, write down key learnings for city directories. Then use the learnings for searches for a U.S. ancestor.
  • * Proficient: Same as above, for two or more ancestors.

content.text:
1. Learn about Wyoming city directories in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Wyoming Directories

  2. Sites: Explore Wyoming city directories on the Ancestor Hunt site.
  3. Find out more about city directories in this research guide from Ancestry.

    ☆ AC—Six Things to Find—3 pgs.

  4. Explore Wyoming city directories on the ☆Ancestry site.
  5. Explore Wyoming ☆historical directories by county.
  6. Explore additional links for Wyoming city directories records on the ☆LDSGenealogy site.

choices.name: Use the QUIKLinks (lightning bolts) or Wyoming County links (bottom) to quickly search common record collections for Wyoming.

content.text:
Note : To search records on these sites, you must be registered on the site or be at a FamilySearch Center.

  1. In the QUIKLinks, click the link for FamilySearch, Ancestry, Findmypast, or MyHeritage to view the corresponding record collection.
  2. Scroll down near the bottom of this page to see available county records. Click the name of the county for FamilySearch, or A for Ancestry, or L for Linkpendium.

1. In FamilySearch, explore the Wyoming Online Genealogy Records page for a variety of record collections.
  2. In each program (FamilySearch, Ancestry, or Findmypast), explore additional record collections besides the ones listed in QUIKLinks.

choices.name: Use Facebook pages to get answers to your questions.

content.text:
1. Visit the Wyoming Genealogy Network page on Facebook.
  2. Visit the Wyoming Genealogy page on Facebook.
  3. Visit the Wyoming Genealogical Society page on Facebook.
  4. Visit the U.S. West Genealogy Research page on Facebook.
  5. See the Genealogy on Facebook list of Facebook groups dedicated to helping with research for Wyoming.

1. Join the RootsChat forum and post questions about Wyoming research.
  2. Explore the Wyoming research mailing lists on Cyndi's List.
  3. Use the ☆Ancestry message boards to read or post questions about Wyoming research.

hidden.content: • * Proficient: Make a list of Facebook groups, mailing lists, and genealogy societies of interest, and then join or subscribe to them.

content.text:
1. Learn about genealogy societies in Wyoming in this FamilySearch Wiki article.

    ☆ FS—Wiki: Wyoming Societies

  2. Explore the Wyoming State Historical Societysite.
  3. Explore Wyoming genealogy society sites on Cyndi's List.
  4. Get help at a family history center in Wyoming.
